article: Every country has its own dining customs.Americans feel that the first rule of being a16 _ guest is to be on time.If a person is invited to dinner at six thirty, the hostess 17 _ him to be there at six thirty or at most a few minutes later.Because she 18 _ does the cooking ahead of time, she has to time (...)the meal 19 so that the hot rolls , the coffee and the meat can be at their best when the guests come.If they are late, the food will not be so _ ,and the hostess will be 21 _ .If the guest cannot come on time, he should call the22 _ or hostess on the phone, give the23 _ ,and tell at what time he can come.24 Depending on the situations, guests sometimes bring a box of candy, a bottle of wine or a bunch of flowers to give to the hostess as a sign of25 _ .  As guests 26 _ to arrive, it is usually considered polite for the men in the group to27 _ when a woman enters the room and continue to stand until she is seated.28 However , most young people and some groups of elder people who stress the 29 _ of the sexes no longer observe the custom.A visitor should be 30 _ to each situation and follow the lead of the Americans present.  When the guests are ready to sit down at a dinner table, it is a31 _ for the men to help the ladies by32 _ their chairs under them, but some Americans no longer do this, so the visitors must33 _ notice of what others do and do the same.Some customs in America are really changing.In order to 34 _ embarrassment , the best advice that is given to the 35 _ is that he or she should observe more before saying or doing.
